ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Age at first psychiatric illness
Age at first psychotic symptoms, e.g. delusions, hallucinations, thought disorder
Number of hospitalizations for psychiatric illness  include current hospitalization if patient is identified during an admission
Total duration of psychiatric hospitalizations
Time since last psychiatric hospitalization  if patient is identified during an admission, record time since prior hospitalization (if less than one month, record 1 week as .25, 2 weeks as .50)
How long had the patient been treated in an outpatient setting
treatment other specify
Treatment setting, record the setting where patient was receiving treatment when first identified for screening
Notes: 1 = Inpatient ward; 2 = Day or partial hospital; 3 = Outpatient clinic; 4 = Other; 5=not in treatment

ElementDescription: How long had the patient been treated in that setting?
CURRENT ADHERENCE TO PSYCHOTROPIC MEDICATIONS - BEHAVIOR ESTIMATE
Notes: 1 = Took medication all or almost all of the time; 2 = Took medication much of the time and/or at lower dose than prescribed; 3 = Took medication about half the time; 4 = Took medication sporadically or less than half the time; 5 = Did not take medication at all

ElementDescription: CURRENT ADHERENCE TO PSYCHOTROPIC MEDICATIONS - ASSISTANCE/ SUPPORT
Notes: 1 = None � took medication independently; 2 = Received urging, encouragement, or reminder;s 3 = Received supervision � e.g., medication is administered by someone else; 4 = Does not apply � did not take medication

ElementDescription: Number of anti-psychotic medications prescribed.
Number of other psychotropic medications prescribed.
Number of other non-psychotropic medications prescribed.
Number of times per day patient must take medications  include all medications regardless of indication.
Treatment Status Code
Treatment Group
Notes: 1=Long-Acting Injectable Risperidone Microspheres; 2=Second Generation Oral Antipsychotic Medication

ElementDescription: Days from Visit 1
Numeric Visit Number
Notes: -1.5 = Pre-Screening; -1 = Screening; 0 = Baseline; ## = Visit ## (from 1 to 10); Whole numbers = standard monthly visits; #.001 - #.009 = Unscheduled; #.1 = End of Phase 1; #.2 = End of Phase 2; #.3 = End of Phase 3; #.4 = End of Open Choice Phase; #.5 = End of Study; #.6 = Genetic Analysis; 1000=all visits

ElementDescription: Visit name
Site
Age at first psychiatric hospitalization (years)
